name: Fleming's Hotel Munich City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Once again, Tripadvisor reviews are very reliable and this is no exception.
reviews.title: Great hotel, convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: We had a very enjoyable stay here last month. We found the location opposite the main railway station a big plus as we arrived and left Munich by train, and despite having a room facing the station, did not hear any traffic noise at all.
reviews.title: Classy hotel - near station - good restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were incredibly comfortable, and the bathroom well equipped. Travelling with my teenage son made shower time hilarious (due to the glass wall) - but he managed to find a place to sit in the room and watch TV where he couldn't see the shower while I was in it!!
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were fabulous each morning and the wait-staff very friendly, and I also enjoyed use of the gym each day, however some of the equipment there needs a little maintenance.
reviews.title: What more could you ask for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and plan to return in the future.
reviews.title: True Quality service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flemmings is located in the hotel district, so although it's a bit of a walk to the town core, so are all the other hotels. Our room had a king size bed with individual blankets for each of us. The shower has clear glass walls making this a bad place to stay for teenagers with their parents, or co-workers. Breakfast was not inspiring, but was included in the price of the room. Located just across the street from an S-Bahn station, and the main train station, this is an easy jumping off point to anywhere you want to go. Also if you have your own computer, wireless is also free
reviews.title: Best Bet for Your Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a quick tour of Munich and Salzburg in March. The bathroom was very nice, a little small which is true for nearly everything in Europe. The only weird thing is the shower is visible to the entire room. So this hotel is only a good choice if you're traveling with a spouse/partner or solo.
reviews.title: Great Location Near Train Station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We found the location near the train station to be excellent as we came in on the subway system from the airport and then went by train to Salzburg one day and to the castles another. It's probably not a great location though if you are not intending to use the train station. There didn't seem to be too many restaurants or bars/beer houses around.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was provided every morning and was a large spread. There were made to order eggs and then a buffet with cheeses, meats, breads, yogurts, and pretty much anything you could need.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very good hotel well recommended,very helpful freindly staff.rooms are excellent and new.location of hotel is good near station so you can travel around quickly.breakfast was also very good
reviews.title: Great hotel staffed by very pleasant and helpful folks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this hotel at the end of our Europen vacation. The room was really beautiful with a very large elegant shower, very modern furnishings, and large size. We even got an addititional pillow from the desk staff when we needed one. Overall this hotel was great. We shyed away from the sauna in the basement as we are American and do not want to sit with a bunch of naked people we don't know. The only gripe was the cost. The room price increases dramatically during the week, so we chose a different hotel for our monday night before our flight home.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. We were there for Okturfest 2009 and we walked. It's was only about 12 blocks or so. We rode the train a great deal and the Fleming is right across the street. Everyone working at the hotel were warm and friendly. The desk clerk greeted us each morning and evening when we came back in. The rooms were clean, comfortable and
reviews.title: Perfect In Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: contemporary, but not "cold". I enjoyed getting up each morning and going to a fabulous breakfast. Again we were greeted with much hospitality and warmth. One night we came in and were very hungry. We had their deli sandwiches and enjoyed every crumb. We would stay here again in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel, the staff very friendly, and very helpful.....our room was great, and with the state of the art bathroom! Plenty of storage space.....and wifi offered.........had to find an internet cafe, as I did not bring my laptop...........across the street from the train station.......would recommend to all........breakfast was awesome, and a very nice restaurant.....................
reviews.title: Would not stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over priced, can do better!!
reviews.title: The Hills Are Alive With the Sound of Munich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Although the Flemings is located close to the train station in Munich, and the district is rather shady, it is a great stay! The hotel is centrally located and due to the proximity of the train station give you easy access to all areas of Munich.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The check-in is quick, friendly and efficient. The rooms are very nice, with open glass encased bathrooms, high ceilings and superb lighting. Simply a feel good place with a touch of wellness oasis. Even if your room is towards the main street you will still have a quiet night.
reviews.title: The kind of place that makes me want to write a review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is very good as well. Service is impeccable and the food is great for a good value. Wireless internet is free and works perfect. And yes, check-out was also a very painless and quick event.
reviews.title: Far out from the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you come to Munich, whether on business or pleasure, this is surely a great hotel to stay at, which offers great value. I would definitely recomment the Flemings!
reviews.title: A gem of hotel in a central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The service was very cordial and proffessional and everyone's english was impeccable.
reviews.title: Central location, great rooms, delicious breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally situated just 1 minute from the main rail station. Nicely appointed room in a contemporary style. Full view of shower compartment caused much hilarity at first but quickly got used to it. Free internet was a welcome surprise as was the quality of the breakfast and service with a smile throughout. The inhouse Bistro served quality food and drink at prices comparable with bars in the area and not inflated like some of the other hotels. I doubt if the more expensive hotels nearby could give an overall quality rating as this place.
reviews.title: Great value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Flemings Hotel is located 1 min away from the main railway station in Munich.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also a very nice 10 min walk from dowtown Munich. Along the way, there are beautiful buildings to photograph, department stores to browse in and coffee shops..
reviews.title: Good mid priced hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the hotel to be extremely comfortable, clean and very modern. The only downside is that if you're travelling with friends, be sure to not have a shower whilst in the room together as the shower / bathroom is stainless steel glass and whilst the design is very modern, there is no privacy.
reviews.title: Precisely What I Needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was extremely comfortable - the sheets, dooner, pillows, bathroom towels etc were all very clean. The bathroom amenities were very nice too.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in good location and excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Very good, helpful staff. Clean, stylish room. Mine had a large 20'x7’ balcony. Good rate, included breakfast buffet and wi-fi. Wi-fi was included in rate, but was broken for my 3-nite stay. Another hotel a block away offered backup wi-fi service. Small CRT TV, three English channels, Sky News, BBC World News, and CNN. Excellent breakfast buffet, including cooked to order bacon and eggs.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Great time in Flemings
reviews.text: If you are looking for a traditional German neighborhood, you may want to consider another part of town. The neighborhood is kinda seedy, but safe. There are a few adult store fronts and seemed to be a mostly Turkish neighborhood. The hotel, however, is convenient to the main train station, the subway system and all the extended hour shops & tourist assistance at the main train station. Overall, I liked this hotel very much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service. Spacious rooms (even if the glass showers are a bit freaky)... Breakfast was complimentary on our tariff and it was a nice way to start the day... Really convenient for the hyper-efficient public transport system...
reviews.title: Fantastic Value and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location across the road from the train station, although it didnt feel that safe around the train station even during the daytime. Compared to other european cities I have visited Munich didnt feel as safe as other places. We got an excellent deal staying at this hotel, it was fantastic value for the location and quality of food and service.
reviews.title: great hotel, best location for traveling by train or making connections.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We took a day trip to salzburg which is very beautiful and can take as little as an hour and 15 mins depending on the price you are willing to pay for faster train.
reviews.title: Lovely place- 6 relaxing nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fabulous boutique style hotel. We stayed here between 5th and 10th February so we got a good feel of the place. Our room 410 was small in size but well furnished. The beds were comfortable and the quilts were toasty warm. There was a desk, wardrobe,two bed side tables and a minibar/tv table. The bathroom was basically part of the bedroom which was fine for us as a couple but it might prove a little too intimate for friends wishing to share a room. The room was very quiet even though the hotel was on a main road across the road from the main train station.
reviews.title: The place to stay!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The breakfast was good all fresh produce. Bread, fruit, cereal, and bacon and eggs made to order, with a good choice of tea coffee and fresh fruit juices. We also had dinner which was also good although they have the same menu every night.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel also had under ground car parking facilities at a cost of 14 euros a day.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A short 10 to 15 minute walk or the "S Bahn" will get you into the town centre (1 euro 10 cents per single single journey)
reviews.title: Ottimo!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all this is a good choice of hotel if you are in Munich.
reviews.title: Munich Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff was very helpful and professional. Rooms were clean and breakfast was good. Did not encounter anything negative so cannot comment on other persons experience which had me a little skeptical at first. Rooms were quite adequate. I was not expecting a five star hotel it was just simply what I wanted. Would definitely stay here again, wish I could have stayed longer. Aircondition a plus. Make sure you meet Philip.
reviews.title: reception made it worthwhile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Effective mix between a business and leisure hotel. Exceptionally clean. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very good, but not great, breakfast. Other hotels on our tour of Germany offered a greater variety of food. Location is incredibly convenient if traveling by train. Don't worry about HBF noise -- at this hotel there isn’t any. The neighborhood is not "old world" Germany. Still cool. Pedestrian zone, bierhalls, Marienplatz, Viktualienmarkt are all very walkable from here. Modern rooms are not huge but adequate. The glass encased shower two feet from the bed is unique and very Euro.
reviews.title: I'd Stay Here Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in September 2009.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located directly across the street from the main train station. Don't let that deter you. The train station makes it very convenient to get anywhere in Munich or elsewhere in Europe, and doesn't cause any noise. There are many hotels located near the train station. We liked the fact that Fleming's was located directly on the main street across from the station, as the side streets house numerous sex shops which we were largely able to ignore. It is about a ten minute walk to the main pedestrian area, or two stops on the train. We found the location extremely convenient.
reviews.title: Good place naer main station..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel rooms were spotlessly clean. The rooms were very comfortable, with the possible exception of the pillows which were the flattest pillows I have ever tried sleeping on (and normally I like a flat pillow). There was free wireless internet that worked well. There was a fitness room in the basement, although I didn't use it. Our room had a mini fridge. It was comfortably air conditioned, although it was also possible to open the windows. The only downside was the shower. The shower is separated from the bedroom area by unfrosted glass. You are completely on display while showering and this could be a problem depending who you are traveling with. It was a very unusual setup.
reviews.title: What more can you expect from a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never having booked a trip to a hotel not referred to by a friend, we were a bit apprehensive about making our reservations. Our concerns were quickly set aside when we entered the hotel. The staff was very helpful, the rooms clean and the location just a quick walk across the street (or under) to the central train station (but you can walk everywhere, train not needed). Being a very particular eater, I was very pleased with the daily breakfast in the hotel restaurant as well as the fruit provided in the room. There is some street noise and if you are a light sleeper, you may want to travel with a sound machine. Otherwise, we were very pleased with our visit and recommend this hotel to other travelers.
reviews.title: Breakfast included

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Flemings after reading previous reviews and were not disappointed .
reviews.title: Clean modern hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is modern and clean with fantastic bathrooms - the shower is part of the bedroom - so share a room with someone your are very close to!
reviews.title: Fabulous Flemings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked a long weekend in Munich for the Christmas market, the hotel was within walking distance of the outdoor ice rink and a further 10 mins stroll took you to the main shopping area and Marienplatz.
reviews.title: Good hotel in very convenient location - very good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alternatively the hotel is located across from the main railway station, Munich has a great rail network - clean, reliable and pretty cheap.
reviews.title: Excellent Small Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at the hotel, in the heart of Munich. The location is only a three short block walk from the Hauptbahnhof (Central Rail Station) and is only two blocks from the U-bahn (Subway) entrance. The hotel was clean and the room very modern. The size was good for a European hotel. Breakfast was included, which consisted of a cold buffet with waiter service for hot dishes such as eggs and bacon. The glass enclosed shower was very cool as it was outside the washroom, in view of the bedroom. (Great for couples, awkward for others). Overall a great experience.
reviews.title: Great location...clean, comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: been to Munich many times & thought I would try this hotel out.
reviews.title: Avoid-poor value and quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: the only good thing to say about it is the convenient restaurant & train station. found the hotel staff to be particularly unfriendly and unhelpful with the most basic of requests.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms are small and tatty, there are much better hotels nearby which are better value and generally nicer. rather sleep on the street, would never stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have chosen this hotel based on Tripadvisor's reviews and I'm glad most of them were absolutely spot-on. The hotel is located in a very convenient area - right next to main rail/train station, there are many interesting places which can be reached by walking (including a city tour bus). The staff is very friendly and efficient. The rooms are pretty clean and comfortable. They have a weird design choice for shower room (transparent glass walls - you can see everything that is going on there right from your bed) but at least the toilet area has a proper privacy. If you're staying with someone else and don't want to see their ugly, flabby naked body, be aware of this peculiarity. The A/C, at least in my room, worked very, very good, which was surprising (first hotel in Europe where I didn't set the thermostat to lowest possible setting). The room had a decent WiFi internet, completely free, which was also surprising. The breakfast was pretty delicious. Overall a pretty positive experience and would gladly stay there again if I'll ever visit this city in future.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in a Central Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel to visit the Christmas Markets and we thought it was an absolutely perfect place to stay. The staff were pleasant and professional all through our stay.
reviews.title: A perfect city base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given a suite on the top floor (6th) which consists of a downstairs lounge area with a television and the wardrobe area also downstairs is a large glass screened shower a glass sink and a separate wc. Then up some spiral stairs to the open plan bedroom with another television and another wc. There are velux widows in the roof which can be opened remotely from a downstairs control which also closes shutters over the windows if you wish.
reviews.title: Stay Here!

description: This is where it all happens! Fleming’s Hotel Munich-City right in the heart of the Bavarian capital extends you a big welcome. Like all of our hotels, this 4-star hotel in Munich city centre offering lots of comfort and an innovative design is impressive.An ambiance of well-being has been created – starting with a morning shower in the fully-glassed bathroom to dinner in the trendy setting of our Brasserie. Are you looking for that little bit more? Then you’ll be right at home here. Welcome to our central hotel in Munich!
